title: Captive Nations Week, 2025
summary: 2025-14691.pdf is a presidential proclamation issued by Donald J. Trump, designating the third week of July 2025 as Captive Nations Week. The proclamation reaffirms the United States' commitment to supporting individuals living under oppressive regimes and advancing global peace, freedom, and human dignity. It highlights the ongoing efforts of various U.S. entities to defend religious freedom worldwide and emphasizes the belief that rights are God-given, not granted by governments. The proclamation calls on all Americans to reaffirm their commitment to supporting those striving for liberty, justice, and the rule of law through appropriate ceremonies and activities. The document also underscores the U.S.'s resolve to work with allies and adversaries alike to pursue strong diplomacy, resolve conflicts, and forge lasting peace.
